title: Free elect. in Nigeria, candidate controls in Iran

content.question: Which of the following is an implication for competitiveness of the electoral process in Nigeria and Iran?

choices.label: The Nigerian government has established an independent electoral commission to encourage competitiveness in elections, while the Iranian government continues to impose strict limits on who can run for office.

Iranian legislative elections are very competitive because the Guardian Council encourages free and fair elections, while Nigerian legislative elections are not very competitive because the incumbent always wins.
Electoral competition in Iran and Nigeria is limited, and both countries ban women from running in presidential or legislative elections.
In Nigeria, the government requires that a certain number of seats in the legislature are reserved for minority groups, whereas in Iran there are no legislative seats reserved for specific groups.

content.answer: The Nigerian government has established an independent electoral commission to encourage competitiveness in elections, while the Iranian government continues to impose strict limits on who can run for office.
